page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY cont'd
page.content: {THE TOWN HALL}occupies the site of the town house of the Lairds of Blairquhan It originally extended across the main street onto part of the premises now occupied by the Royal Bank and Camerons Garage. This building is believed to have been older than the { {CASTLE.}At the end of the 17thC. it became the town courthouse and gaol. Most of the building was then removed. In 1887 the present town hall was built retaining only parts of the original tower. {CROSSRAGUEL ABBEY}probably gaelic for the abbey "of the holy cross built in stone". It was founded by Duncan Earl of Carrick in the 13thC. A dispute occurred between the Clunaic mother house of Paisley Abbey and the Earl because lands and revenues allocated were retained but only a small chapel built.
